abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry says United States cannot be expected to lift trade embargo on Cuba unless Cuban government addresses its record on human rights; is first secretary of state to visit country in 70 years and two sides agree to form steering committee to address human rights, which Cuban authorities seem to be inflexible on, as well as other thorny issues.
lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry attended a ceremony at the diplomatic post, which officially opened in July, before talking to dissidents at a separate reception.

headline.main: Kerry Strikes Delicate Balance in Havana Trip for Embassy Flag-Raising
headline.print_headline: Kerry, in Havana, Links Trade Embargo to Rights

snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry attended a ceremony at the diplomatic post, which officially opened in July, before talking to dissidents at a separate reception.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
